description: Core standard library functions and types for the Kairo language

functions.name: as_cast<To, From>
functions.description: Performs a safe cast from one type to another

functions.name: as_const<To, From>
functions.description: Converts a type to a const type

functions.name: as_unsafe<To, From>
functions.description: Performs an unsafe cast from one type to another

functions.name: next
functions.description: Retrieves the next value from a generator

functions.name: endl
functions.description: Represents an endline character for output streaming in print function call

functions.name: stringf
functions.description: Formats a string using the specified format and arguments, similar to printf in C

functions.name: crash<T>
functions.description: Crashes the program with a specified Panicable object

functions.name: erase_type<T>
functions.description: Erases the type of an object and returns a TypeErasure object

functions.name: range
functions.description: Creates a range from 0 to last with step 1

functions.name: range
functions.description: Creates a range from first to last with specified step
functions.signature: range(first: T, last: T, step: isize = 1) -> Range<T>

functions.name: to_string
functions.description: Converts various types to string representation

functions.name: char_to_cchar
functions.description: Converts a wide character to a char (c-char)

functions.name: nstring_to_string
functions.description: Converts a nstring to a string (nstring being kairo::String::basic<char>)

functions.name: nptr_to_string
functions.description: Converts a C-style string pointer to a string with specified size
functions.signature: nptr_to_string(cstr: const char*, size: size_t) -> string

functions.name: string_to_nstring
functions.description: Converts a string to a nstring

functions.name: wptr_to_nptr
functions.description: Converts a wide string pointer to a C-style string pointer
functions.signature: wptr_to_nptr(wstr: const wchar_t*, buffer: char*, buffer_size: size_t) -> void

classes.name: Function<ReturnType, Args...>
classes.description: Represents a function type with specified return type and argument types

classes.name: Generator<YieldType>
classes.description: Represents a generator type that yields values of the specified type, C++ coroutines are used in the implementation
classes.note: In Kairo syntax, use 'yield T' which becomes Generator<T>

classes.name: null_t
classes.description: Represents a null value, used for null pointers or null values in containers

classes.name: TypeErasure
classes.description: A type erasure mechanism that allows for type removal

methods.name: operator*
methods.description: Dereference operator to access the erased object

methods.name: type_info
methods.description: Returns type information about the erased object

methods.name: clone
methods.description: Creates a copy of the type-erased object

classes.name: Range<T>
classes.description: Represents a range of values of type T

constructors.name: Range
constructors.signature: Range(self, first: T, last: T, step: isize = 1)
constructors.description: Creates a range from first to last with specified step

constructors.name: Range
constructors.description: Creates a range from 0 to last with step 1

operators.name: operator in
operators.description: Contains operator to check if value is in range
operators.signature: fn op in (self, value: T)[contains] -> bool

methods.name: begin
methods.description: Returns the beginning value of the range

methods.name: end
methods.description: Returns the ending value of the range

methods.name: step
methods.description: Returns the step value of the range

methods.name: contains
methods.description: Checks if a value is within the range

methods.name: is_empty
methods.description: Checks if the range is empty

classes.name: Questionable<T>
classes.description: Represents a type that can be nullable or panicable
classes.note: In Kairo syntax, use 'T?' which becomes Questionable<T>

operators.name: operator?
operators.description: Collapse operator to get T | null_t | Error

operators.name: operator in
operators.signature: op in(self, const E& other) -> bool
